result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mariah M Trujillo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mariah M Trujillo in court.  
Attorney Joseph P Bastien V in court for Mariah M Trujillo. 
Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Final Pretrial.
In chambers discussion held to case called on the record,
Parties request to vacate trial date and set case for a Status.
Court vacated 10-17-2022 trial date and ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.
Received and filed: State's Witness List.
Received and filed: STATE'S MOTION IN LIMINE.

ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD.
Case in court for a Final pretrial.
Ada Corr is in trial in a different court and this court is in trial on a different case.
Court ordered case adjourned. New date confirmed with defense counsel. State notified.
Case remains calendared in branch 19. Jury Trial calendared for October 17, 2022 at 9:00am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and filed: DEFENDANT'S Proposed Jury Instructions.
Received and filed: DEFENDANT'S MOTION IN LIMINE.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.

ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD VIA EMAIL.
Case calendared for a Final Pretrial. 
This court is in trial on a different matter and ordered scheduled hearing adjourned
New date confirmed with the parties.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mariah M Trujillo in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Scheduling Conference. Defense request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19. Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, room 313 of the courthouse.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Mariah M Trujillo in court with Attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective G. Gonzales. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.    
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report

Defendant Mariah M Trujillo in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a State vs. Lee hearing. Defense counsel Joseph Bastien has been appointed to the case by the public defenders office. Case adjourned to preliminary hearing court for a prleiminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated July 5, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Mariah M Trujillo in court, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is GRANTED. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a STATE V-LEE Hearing in the trial court. Court advised defendant of open No Contact order and no firearms.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Defendant Mariah M Trujillo in court, appear in person.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court reminds defendant of No Contact Order with no firearms and the conditions with Justice Point still remains active. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-11-2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Mariah M Trujillo in court with Attorney Travis Schwantes via zoom.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Defense motion to dismiss.  For reasons stated on the record the court denies defense request.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL
Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). The matter is adjourned to Prelim Court for the Preliminary Hearing on May 12,2022 at 8:30am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  MCD DOB 6/2/02
Received and Filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
